intro: Psychotria argentinensis, commonly known as the Argentine Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
